content.description: A short, dirty, and loose 5.8+ that should be avoided...except that it's necessary for accessing Sparklehorse and the Son Volt Arete.
content.protection: 4 bolts with a 2-bolt anchor directly above the fourth bolt (use this anchor for Sparklehorse) and another 2-bolt anchor off to the right: take the vegetated ledge right and find this anchor just around the corner of the arete (use this anchor for Son Volt).  First bolt is hard to see and is maybe 15' up on a dark colored, low angle piece of slab.  Bolts 2-3 on the prow.  Bolt 4 above and left of the prow as you go through the "jungle" corner.
content.location: Right side of Kiliak wall, not far past Eagle Reefer.

content.description:
The right most climb on this section of wall. Climb crimpy bulges to the right side of the roof. climb stays consistently right of the bolts until the last bolt.  Pay attention to what you grab, some holds near the top are a bit loose. Pumpy! Shares a funky anchor with Stoner Boyz. 

  There is rumor of a second pitch with 1 bolt and a couple of pins. It takes gear and looks dirty, though, it may clean up with traffic. Apparently there is a tree anchor and a 70m rope will get you to the ground. 5.8?
A fun addition to the right side of the left wall. Climb slopers and side pulls 5 ft left of a broken corner system. Hopefully someone can provide the name and FA info for this fun line.
content.location: Furthest right route on the left wall.

content.description: Start on small crimps and good feet 6 feet left of FPOS. Crimp trough the shallow corner to good holds at the left end of the roof and head direct to the anchor.

climbs.name: Stoner Boyz
climbs.fa: RC, Zach Schlosar, Carl Oswald, Ben Chriswell

content.description: Squeezed between Stoner girl and the climb directly to the right. for the first 40 feet, you can actually touch the bolts of either route. The climbing on this leaves much to be desired. be wary of loose holds towards the second to last bolt...
content.protection: 6 bolts, fairly strange rap anchor in rather marginal rock.
content.location: from the path to the wall, cut left this is the second route you comes to on the wall.

content.description: Start at 'Welcome to the Jungle' anchor. Stem past a bolt and nut placement into a steep, left-facing corner. Face climb left up thin edges (5.10a), passing a handful of bolts. Move straight up to a splitter finger crack (5.9). Jam this for 30' to chain anchors. A very enjoyable pitch.  I recommend carrying wire brushes to clean dirty holds as this climb probably doesn't receive much traffic.
content.protection:
6 bolts, gear to 2".  Chain anchors  

These  anchors were hand-drilled in 2001.  Due to the fractured nature of the rock, and the yearly freeze/ thaw cycles in the area, these anchors should be checked for safety, and used with caution.
content.location: Starts on mossy ledge directly above 'Welcome To The Jungle'.  Rappel with 60 meter rope.

content.description: Climb the garbage "Welcome to the Jungle" (sketchy 5.8) past four bolts to its 2-bolt anchor.  Move right from that anchor along the vegetated ledge just around the corner of the arete.  There are two low bolts here to anchor on for Son Volt.  Climb up the arete, mostly direct but in some places to the right of it.  Sustained, hard 5.10 climbing and relatively difficult for the grade.  Rock seems to be mostly solid, but watch for smaller loose pieces and crumbles.  There is quite a bit of lichen too.  It's a fun climb but would be better with more traffic and cleaning.
content.location: Right side of Kiliak Wall.  Starts from the vegetated ledge accessed by climbing "Welcome to the Jungle."

climbs.name: High Speed Dirt
climbs.fa: Matt Farmer, Ryan Campbell, Dave Ahrens, Andy Hoyt

content.description: Climb a dirty arete for 30 feet then the awesome begins. climb on super jugs and stellar in-cut edges along a crack system to you right for the most part. This may feel spacey for the gym climber, but it's one of the best lines at the wall! Watch for some loose holds at the top. Bring webbing or cord to replace exist anchor mank. lower with a 70m rope
content.location: from the path to the wall, head right this is the first line you you'll see. starts on a dirty arete then cuts left.

content.description: The Left most line at the cliff. Climb bulges on good holds, trending left at the top. Find the anchor in an alcove after a grass move or two.

Start in the corner to the right of High Speed Dirt and climb crimps, jugs, and pockets to the roof. Climb left around the roof to a short corner then a fantastic finger crack. Great calcite covered rock in the crux. Bring a 70m rope to lower. When dry, a fantastic climb for the grade.

Kiliak Wall is a beautiful area with generally decent rock and fantastic views. The wall is south facing and gets sun for most of the day, a plus when climbing in the spring or fall. The routes here tend to be well protected and moderately graded.
